intro: Casselia confertiflora, commonly known as the dense-flowered casselia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, featuring narrow, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces small, round fruits that are edible but not widely cultivated. Casselia confertiflora is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
